intro: Chiridium setigerum, commonly known as the hairy chiridium, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, hairy stems and small, yellowish to brownish flower heads that are typically arranged in clusters. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Chiridium setigerum is often found in grasslands and open habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
